â“ Yellow Leaves:
Cause: Overwatering.
Solution: Water only when topsoil feels dry.

â“ Pests on Plants:
Cause: Aphids, caterpillars.
Solution: Spray neem oil or use organic pesticides.

â“ Plants Wilting:
Cause: Root rot.
Solution: Improve soil drainage.

â“ Poor Soil Quality:
Cause: Lack of nutrients.
Solution: Add compost and organic fertilizers.

â“ Stunted Growth:
Cause: Not enough sunlight.
Solution: Move to a sunnier location.

âœ… Tip: Regular care and observation = Healthy Plants!

ğŸŒ± **What is Organic Farming?**
Organic farming is a method of growing crops and raising animals without synthetic chemicals like pesticides, herbicides, or fertilizers. It promotes ecological balance and aims to conserve biodiversity.
ğŸ‘©â€ğŸŒ¾ **Core Principles**: â€¢ Maintain healthy soil through composting and crop rotation â€¢ Avoid GMOs and harmful synthetic inputs â€¢ Promote animal welfare and natural behavior â€¢ Emphasize sustainability and resource conservation
ğŸ™ï¸ **Urban Relevance**: Urban organic farming brings food production to rooftops, balconies, and small plots in cities. This empowers citizens to eat healthier, reduce carbon footprint, and reconnect with nature.
ğŸ’¡ **Did You Know?** Over 90% of urban households can grow herbs and leafy vegetables with minimal effort â€” right on their balconies!

ğŸŒ¿ **Urban Gardening Tips**
1ï¸âƒ£ **Start with Simple Plants** Begin with herbs like Tulsi, Mint, Coriander â€” they require little care and grow well in pots.
2ï¸âƒ£ **Use Organic Soil Mix** Combine compost, cocopeat, and garden soil. Avoid synthetic fertilizers.
3ï¸âƒ£ **Watering Schedule** Water early morning. Never overwater. Use recycled water when possible.
4ï¸âƒ£ **Light Air** Keep plants where they get 4â€“6 hours of indirect sunlight. Ensure airflow.
5ï¸âƒ£ **Pest Management** Use neem spray or garlic-turmeric water. No chemicals needed.
6ï¸âƒ£ **Container Choices** Use old buckets, bottles, or eco-pots. Drill drainage holes!
ğŸŒ± **Bonus Tip**: Compost your kitchen waste into rich fertilizer!

ğŸŒ **Soil Pollution Awareness**
Soil is not just dirt â€” itâ€™s a living system full of microbes, minerals, and life. But itâ€™s in danger.
âŒ **Main Pollutants**: â€¢ Pesticides â€¢ Heavy metals from industry â€¢ Plastics and non-biodegradable waste â€¢ Excessive chemical fertilizers
ğŸ“‰ **Effects**: â€¢ Poor plant growth â€¢ Contaminated food supply â€¢ Polluted groundwater â€¢ Soil infertility and erosion
âœ… **Solutions**: â€¢ Switch to compost and organic manure â€¢ Grow native plants â€¢ Stop using plastic mulching â€¢ Educate your community
ğŸŒ± Growing even one plant in clean soil makes a difference.

ğŸ› ï¸ **Common Gardening Problems & Solutions**
â— **Yellowing Leaves** â€¢ Cause: Overwatering or poor drainage â€¢ Fix: Let soil dry between watering
ğŸ› **Pests on Plants** â€¢ Cause: Aphids, mealybugs â€¢ Fix: Use neem oil, garlic spray, or companion planting
ğŸ¥€ **Wilting Plants** â€¢ Cause: Root rot or fungal infection â€¢ Fix: Repot with dry soil and better drainage
ğŸŒ‘ **Stunted Growth** â€¢ Cause: Lack of nutrients or sunlight â€¢ Fix: Add compost; relocate for better light
ğŸƒ **Leaf Burn** â€¢ Cause: Excess sun or fertilizer â€¢ Fix: Adjust exposure; flush soil with clean water
ğŸ“ˆ **General Tip**: Observe daily and record changes to spot issues early.
